contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to another messenger. Alternate translation: "another messenger also came" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

This expression intensifies the statement of Job's grief by going even further back in time from his birth to his conception. Alternate translation: "the night that said, 'A boy has been conceived' perish." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: the night that said, 'A boy has been conceived.'

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb "fill" is understood from the previous clause. God causing him to shout for joy is spoken of as if God had poured joy into Job's mouth. Alternate translation: "God will cause you to shout for joy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])

The command "Ask the fish of the sea" is understood from the previous sentences. It functions as a hypothetical condition. Alternate translation: "and if you were to ask the fish of the sea, they would declare to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-imperative]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hypo]])
contextId.glQuote: the fish of the sea will declare to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is implied that this is what will happen if he trusts in useless things. Alternate translation: "for if he trusts in them, uselessness will be his reward" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: for uselessness will be his reward

contextId.occurrenceNote: The understood verbal phrase "is hidden" may be supplied. Alternate translation: "a trap is hidden on the path to catch him" or "someone will hide a trap to catch him in the way" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

After "spider," the phrase "builds its web" is understood information. It can be made clear. Alternate translation: "He builds his house as a spider builds its web" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: He builds his house like a spider

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "But I have done none of those things" is understood from the context. Alternate translation: "But I have done none of those things, because from my youth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
The words "let" and "grow" are understood from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "let weeds grow instead of barley" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
This refers to a child's flesh. Alternate translation: "a child's flesh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

This is part of the previous question. The understood words from the previous verse, "will you condemn God," may be supplied. Alternate translation: "Will you condemn God, who says to a king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: God, who says to a king

contextId.occurrenceNote: The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "he reveals to them their transgressions and their pride" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "likewise, he says to the rain shower" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

The verb may be supplied from the previous phrase. Alternate translation: "or do you understand the marvelous deeds of God" or "and you do not understand the marvelous deeds of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])

The words "can you" are understood from the previous question. They can be repeated here. God uses this question to remind Job that Job is not powerful like Leviathan. This question can be translated as a statement.  Alternate translation:  "Or can you tie up his jaws with a cord?" or "And you know that you cannot tie up his jaws with a cord." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: Or tie up his jaws with a cord?

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can make this clear by adding the omitted words. Alternate translation: "he thinks of weapons made of bronze as if they were weapons made of rotten wood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: of bronze as if it were rotten wood

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may want to repeat the words "I know." Alternate translation: "I know that you can do all things. I know that no purpose of yours can be stopped" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: I know that you can do all things, that no purpose of yours can be stopped

contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "he blesed" and "of Job's life" are understood from the previous phrase. They can be repeated here Alternate translation: "more than he blessed the first part of Job's life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
